Malachi or Malachias__03.1: Behold I send<u>my angel</u>, and he shall prepare the way before my face. And presently the Lord, whom you seek, and the angel of the testament, whom you desire, shall come to his temple. Behold he cometh, saith the Lord of hosts.
Malachi or Malachias__03.2: And who shall be able to think of the day of his coming? and who shall stand to see him? for he is like a refining fire, and like the fuller's herb:
Malachi or Malachias__03.3: And he shall sit refining and cleansing the silver, and he shall purify the sons of Levi, and shall refine them as gold, and as silver, and they shall offer sacrifices to the Lord in justice.
Malachi or Malachias__03.4: And the sacrifice of Juda and of Jerusalem shall please the Lord, as in the days of old, and in the ancient years.
Malachi or Malachias__03.5: And I will come to you in judgment, and will be a speedy witness against sorcerers, and adulterers, and false swearers, and them that oppress the hireling in his wages; the widows, and the fatherless: and oppress the stranger, and have not feared me, saith the Lord of hosts.
Malachi or Malachias__03.6: For I am the Lord, and I change not: and you the sons of Jacob are not consumed.
Malachi or Malachias__03.7: For from the days of your fathers you have departed from my ordinances, and have not kept them: Return to me, and I will return to you, saith the Lord of hosts. And you have said: Wherein shall we return?
Malachi or Malachias__03.8: Shall a man afflict God? for you afflict me. And you have said: Wherein do we afflict thee? in tithes and in firstfruits.
Malachi or Malachias__03.9: And you are cursed with want, and you afflict me, even the whole nation of you.
Malachi or Malachias__03.10: Bring all the tithes into the storehouse, that there may be meat in my house, and try me in this, saith the Lord: if I open not unto you the flood-gates of heaven, and pour you out a blessing even to abundance.
Malachi or Malachias__03.11: And I will rebuke for your sakes the devourer, and he shall not spoil the fruit of your land: neither shall the vine in the field be barren, saith the Lord of hosts.
Malachi or Malachias__03.12: And all nations shall call you blessed: for you shall be a delightful land, saith the Lord of hosts.
Malachi or Malachias__03.13: Your words have been unsufferable to me, saith the Lord.
Malachi or Malachias__03.14: And you have said: What have we spoken against thee? You have said: He laboureth in vain that serveth God, and what profit is it that we have kept his ordinances, and that we have walked sorrowful before the Lord of hosts?
Malachi or Malachias__03.15: Wherefore now we call the proud people happy, for they that work wickedness are built up, and they have tempted God and are preserved.
Malachi or Malachias__03.16: Then they that feared the Lord spoke every one with his neighbour: and the Lord gave ear, and heard it: and a book of remembrance was written before him for them that fear the Lord, and think on his name.
Malachi or Malachias__03.17: And they shall be my special possession, saith the Lord of hosts, in the day that I do judgment: and I will spare them, as a man spareth his son that serveth him.
Malachi or Malachias__03.18: And you shall return, and shall see the difference between the just and the wicked: and between him that serveth God, and him that serveth him not.
